medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal discomfort in the lower quadrants, primarily right-sided, following recent treatment for uncomplicated diverticulitis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has experienced three prior episodes of uncomplicated diverticulitis over several years, each treated with antibiotics. She was recently admitted to another facility for treatment, initially receiving flagyl/ceftriaxone and later transitioned to oral ciprofloxacin/flagyl. She completed this course of antibiotics one week ago but has not felt fully recovered, continuing to experience fatigue and abdominal discomfort in her lower quadrants, which worsened on the day of presentation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Atrial fibrillation not on anticoagulation, diverticulitis, intestinal malrotation, polysplenia.
medical_history.family_history: Father with coronary artery disease, lung cancer, and diverticulitis; mother with breast cancer. No notable family history of gastrointestinal malignancy.
